definition: spring/coil spring (spiral spring used to power clockwork)
to send out/to show (one's feeling)/to issue/to develop/to make a bundle of money/classifier for gunshots (rounds)
strip/item/article/clause (of law or treaty)/classifier for long thin things (ribbon, river, road, trousers etc)

sentences.english: He took the spring out of the clock but now he can't get it back.
sentences.chinese: 他將鐘錶裏的發條取了出來，可現在裝上不了。

sentences.english: I must have forgotten to wind last night.
sentences.chinese: 昨晚我一定忘了上發條了。

sentences.english: My watch has stopped for I didn't wind it last night.
sentences.chinese: 我的手錶停了，因爲我昨晚沒有上發條。

sentences.english: I forgot to wind my watch up, so of course it stopped.
sentences.chinese: 我忘記給表上發條了，它自然就停了。

sentences.english: Yeah, the self-winding coil is loose.
sentences.chinese: 是的，自動上發條的線圈鬆了。

sentences.english: I forgot to wind up my alarm clock the night before.
sentences.chinese: 前一天晚上，我忘記給鬧鐘上發條。

sentences.english: In the beginning we thought that on the wrong car, and like clockwork, like the heart of the tension.
sentences.chinese: 一開始我們以爲上錯車了，心像發條一樣繃緊了。

sentences.english: Did you remember to wind the clock?
sentences.chinese: 你記得給鐘上發條了嗎？

sentences.english: I need to wind the old clock every morning.
sentences.chinese: 每天早晨我要爲老鐘上發條。

sentences.english: But why was it ever wound up in the first place?
sentences.chinese: 但是爲什麼它一開始總是上足發條的呢？

sentences.english: Watch movements, complete and assembled, with automatic winding.
sentences.chinese: 表運轉體，整體及已裝配，自動上發條者。

sentences.english: The strained string broke, and the wheels of the clock whirred, and the chimes began to strike.
sentences.chinese: 盤緊的發條鬆開了，時鐘在噝噝作響，要鳴響了。

sentences.english: Give the clock another couple of winds .
sentences.chinese: 給這座鐘再上兩圈發條。

sentences.english: He forgot to wind (up) his watch.
sentences.chinese: 他忘了給他的表上發條。

sentences.english: Did you forget to wind it up?
sentences.chinese: 鍾又停了，你忘了上發條是嗎？

sentences.english: I think the mainspring is broken.

definition: to dismantle/to disassemble/to open up (sth sealed)/to unpick
trumpet/small size (clothes etc)/(coll.) number one/to urinate/(humble) our store
to wind around/to wrap round/to coil/tangle/to involve/to bother/to annoy
to stick/to paste/to post (e.g. on a blog)/to keep close to/to fit snugly/to subsidize/allowance (e.g. money for food or housing)/sticker/classifier for sticking plaster: strip
to rotate (about an axis)/to revolve/to turn/to move in a circle/to gyrate
to receive and send/to receive and transmit
